article_title: Health Care Worries Grow as Investors Approach Retirement
article_text:
Health and health care costs are two of investors' five top concerns, Cerulli reported.

The cost of health care has become a chief economic concern among retail investor households in the U.S., according to new research.

According to research from global analytics firm Cerulli Associates, two of the top five overall household concerns are the cost of health care and the “health of myself or family members.”

article_metadata.sailthru.author: Emily Zulz
article_metadata.description: The problem, according to Cerulli, is that there are very few tangible health care solutions for investors entering retirement.

og.description: The problem, according to Cerulli, is that there are very few tangible health care solutions for investors entering retirement.
